hypothesis_content.title: Intraday 'Liquidity Vacuum' Fade in Low-Volume Windows
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/STRESS regimes with recent 'liquidity' news, BTC will exhibit sharp, low-volume spikes (>1.5% in 2 hours) during low-liquidity trading windows (00:00-04:00 UTC). These spikes will fully revert to the pre-spike VWAP 80% of the time within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-liquidity-crash, market depth is thin, especially in off-peak hours. News-driven algos can trigger exaggerated moves on minimal volume that lack follow-through. The 'structural shift' means fewer participants are present to provide continuous liquidity, making these spikes more prone to rapid reversion.
entry_conditions: Volume for that 2H candle is <65% of the average 2H volume of the prior 24H

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the 2H VWAP of the candle immediately preceding the spike candle
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves an additional 1% in the spike direction beyond the spike candle's high/low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Low-volume spikes during the specified window show >50% continuation (exceed spike high/low) instead of reversion, indicating a change in off-hours market structure or the presence of persistent directional algos.
